title: [Large-Scale] Mobile Outdoor Language and Communication Learning Program for Local Socio-Environmental Issue Inquiry

context.prior_knowledge: Basic environmental science concepts, experience in recognizing community issues, ability to analyze basic texts and utilize vocabulary, field survey interview techniques
context.additional_context: Enhances language practitionersâ€™ ability to develop field-applicable educational content (focused on writing, reading, expression, communication) by solving community issues. Prioritizes addressing language barriers related to multiculturalism and historical awareness

learning_goals: Learners collect local community environmental issue data using mobile devices and systematically analyze linguistic materials through text analysis and keyword extraction.
Learners can create a concept map of socio-environmental issues based on field survey results and systematically organize related professional vocabulary and situational expressions.

Learners select one community issue (e.g., language barriers in multicultural families, lack of awareness of local history) and develop a language education content prototype (3 activity modules) integrating writing, reading, and expressive activities. They receive a feasibility evaluation of an average of 4 points or higher on a 5-point scale from an expert review panel.

resources: Environmental Data Measurement Sensors (Air Quality/Noise, etc.)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
